abstract: Dept of Homeland Security report finds just over 1 percent of nearly 45 million visitors to United States overstayed their work or tourist visas in 2015; cases in which those guilty of terrorist activity violated visas prompted report, which officials say will be completed annually moving forward.

headline.print_headline: Few Visitors to the U.S. Violate Visas, a Report Says
headline.main: Few Foreign Visitors to U.S. Overstay Visa, Federal Report Says

snippet: Just over 1 percent of the visitors overstay, said the report, on a subject that has drawn renewed interest in the wake of the killings in San Bernardino, Calif., in December.
lead_paragraph: Just over 1 percent of the visitors overstay, said the report, on a subject that has drawn renewed interest in the wake of the killings in San Bernardino, Calif., in December.
